element.name: TCustomGrid.VisualChange
element.short: Updates the grid after changes to the visual properties in the control

descr.p: VisualChange is a procedure used to update the grid when visual aspects of the control have been changed. VisualChange calls UpdateSizes to refresh the size of cells in the gris, and calls Invalidate to force the control to be redrawn.
No actions are performed in the method when BeginUpdate has been called to buffer updates to the grid. VisualChange will resume updates when EndUpdate has been called to disable update buffering.

element.name: TCustomGrid.WMHScroll
element.short: WMHScroll - system message for horizontal scrolling

element.name: TCustomGrid.WMVScroll
element.short: WMVScroll - system message for vertical scrolling

element.name: TCustomGrid.AllowOutboundEvents
element.short: AllowOutboundEvents - permits mouse click on an imaginary (out-of-bounds) cell; moves cursor to nearest valid cell

descr.p: Normally when a user clicks on a point over the empty space after cells (for example if grid has three rows but user clicks on imaginary fourth row) the current focused cell will move to the nearest cell to clicked point; we call this an outbound event.
Default value is True, as this has been the grid's behavior since the beginning.
This was added to simulate Delphi behavior where outbound events are not available; to enable Delphi compatibility set this to False.

element.name: TCustomGrid.AlternateColor
element.short: The color to be used for the background on alternate rows of the grid. Having alternate rows in different colors can make the grid easier to read.

element.name: TCustomGrid.AutoAdvance
element.short: Automatically advance down the grid on successive mouse clicks or presses of the ENTER or TAB key

element.name: TCustomGrid.AutoEdit
element.short: Whether the Edit mode is automatically entered when a cell is selected

element.name: TCustomGrid.AutoFillColumns
element.short: Automatically resize columns so they fill all grid's visible area

descr.p: When this option is turned on, the grid will resize all columns to fill the grid's client width. What columns are resized is determined by the following conditions:

ol.li: If the grid has Custom Columns, all columns with SizePriority set to 0 are not resized.

descr.p: Note that Custom Columns are initially created with SizePriority=1. For TDbGrid, which automatically adds Custom Columns, this means the user will not be able to resize such columns using the mouse.

element.name: TCustomGrid.BorderStyle
element.descr: Only a restricted series of options is available: none or a single border.

element.name: TCustomGrid.BorderColor
element.short: The color of the border for this control

element.name: TCustomGrid.CellHintPriority
element.short: Identifies how text is combined to form the Hint property

descr.p: CellHintPriority is a TCellHintPriority that identifies how text is combined to form the Hint property. The default value for the is chpAllNoDefault. See for a description of the enumeration values and their meanings.
CellHintPriority is used in the implementation of the ShowCellHintWindow, MouseMove, and GetTruncCellHintText methods.

element.name: TCustomGrid.Col
element.short: Current column index.
element.descr: Col is an Integer which holds the column index of the current grid cell cursor. The current grid column can be changed programmatically by setting a new value to this property.

element.name: TCustomGrid.ColCount
element.short: Number of columns of the grid.

descr.p: ColCount is an Integer that represents the number of columns in the grid, including fixed and normal columns. Changing the value in ColCount after Columns have been created causes an EGridException to be raised. Use the Columns to add or delete columns defined in the grid.
Use FixedColCount for the number of fixed columns in the grid.
Use VisibleColCount for the number of non-fixed columns in the grid.
Use RowCount, FixedRowCount, and VisibleRowCount to access the row-oriented equivalents.

element.errors: Raises an EGridException when the value is changed and Columns already exist in the grid.

element.name: TCustomGrid.ColRow
element.short: Provides access to current column and row numbers as a TPoint instance

descr.p: ColRow is a TPoint used to provide access to the current values in Col and Row as a TPoint instance. The X member in TPoint is used for the value in the Col property. The Y member in TPoint is used for the value in the Row property.

Setting the value for the causes the CheckLimitsWithError method to be called for the X and Y values when AllowOutboundEvents is False. The SetColRow method is called to update the values in the Col and Row properties.

element.name: TCustomGrid.ColRowDraggingCursor
element.short: Cursor shape displayed when a column is dragged or moved

element.name: TCustomGrid.ColRowDragIndicatorColor
element.short: Color used to render the indicator drawn when a column or row is dragged in the grid

element.name: TCustomGrid.ColSizingCursor
element.short: Cursor shape displayed when a column is resized

element.name: TCustomGrid.ColumnClickSorts
element.short: Indicates if clicking a column header changes its sort order

descr.p: ColumnClickSorts is a Boolean used to indicate if clicking a column header changes its sort order. The default value for the is False.
ColumnClickSorts is used in the HeaderClick method to determine if the value in the SortOrder is toggled for a click in the header cell for SortColumn.

element.name: TCustomGrid.Columns
element.short: The properties of the columns in this grid

descr.p: Columns is a TGridColumns used to represent column definitions for the grid control. Columns contains the TGridColumn instances which define the attributes for the column such as its size, shape, color, etc.

Columns should not be confused with the COLUMNS construct frequently used in SQL programming, which refer to Fields of data. The contents of Fields can be displayed as Columns in a Grid, but they must be seen as separate and distinct. It is irrelevant to refer to the color, font or width of a data field from a database, but these are all very relevant in specifying the appearance of a column in a grid.

element.name: TCustomGrid.ColWidths
element.short: Column widths for the grid.

descr.p: The column is specified with the aCol parameter. The aCol parameter must fall within the valid index range of 0 to ColCount-1.
The return value of the is the width of this column, measured in pixels.
The initial width of a newly created column is specified with the DefaultColWidth property. After that the user may redefine this value.
If the Options includes the appropriate option value, the column width may also be changed by the user at run-time.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DefaultColWidth
element.short: Default value for the width of newly created grid columns.

descr.p: If new columns of the grid are created by changing the ColCount property, the width of these new columns will be set to the value of the DefaultColWidth property.
Use 0 for auto-sized width.
Use GetRealDefaultColWidth for real value.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DefaultRowHeight
element.short: Default value for the height of newly created grid rows.

descr.p: If new rows of the grid are created by changing the RowCount property, the height of these new rows will be set to the value of the DefaultRowHeight property.
Use 0 for auto-sized height.
Use GetRealDefaultRowHeight for real value.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DefaultDrawing
element.short: Is the default drawing method to be used for this grid? Default is TRUE

element.name: TCustomGrid.DefaultTextStyle
element.short: Default style for displaying text - includes alignment, layout, single or multi-lines

element.name: TCustomGrid.DisabledFontColor
element.short: Color used to draw text in the grid when the Enabled is False

element.name: TCustomGrid.DragDx
element.short: DragDx - the amount (DeltaX) by which an object should be dragged

element.name: TCustomGrid.Editor
element.short: The editor to be used for modifying information in the cells of the grid

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorBorderStyle
element.short: The border style for the editor used in this grid

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorMode
element.short: Is grid ready to accept edits? (EditorMode True)

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorKey
element.short: EditorKey - is the current key available to the editor?

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorOptions
element.short: The set of options available for the grid's editor

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorShowing
element.short: Is the editor for the grid displayed?

element.name: TCustomGrid.ExtendedColSizing
element.short: ExtendedColSizing - the sizing to be used for extended columns

element.name: TCustomGrid.ExtendedRowSizing
element.short: ExtendedRowSizing - the sizing to be used for extended rows

element.name: TCustomGrid.ExtendedSelect
element.short: ExtendedSelect - the ability to select cells beyond the boundary of the visible part of the grid

element.name: TCustomGrid.FastEditing
element.short: Indicates if fast editing is used in the grid

descr.p: FastEditing is a Boolean which indicates if cell editing initialized by a KeyDown message instead of a navigation key is used in the grid control. The value in FastEditing is used when TPickListCellEditor handles KeyDown messages.
The default value for the is True as assigned in the Create constructor.

element.name: TCustomGrid.AltColorStartNormal
element.short: AltColorStartNormal - using a second color to display alternate rows, but starting the first row with the normal color

descr.p: AltColorStartNormal - using a second color to display alternate rows, but starting the first row with the normal color.
Using a different color for the background of alternate rows often makes the data in a grid much easier to read.

element.name: TCustomGrid.FixedCols
element.short: Number of the fixed columns of the grid (i.e. the columns containing title or identifier material, that don't get scrolled when the rest of the grid moves).

descr.p: Contains the fixed column count of a grid.
Fixed columns are normally used for headings.

element.name: TCustomGrid.FixedRows
element.short: Number of the fixed rows of the grid (i.e. the rows containing title or identifier material, that don't get scrolled when the rest of the grid moves).

descr.p: Contains the fixed row count of a grid.
Fixed rows are normally used for headings.

element.name: TCustomGrid.FixedColor
element.short: The color for the fixed cells of the grid.
element.descr: The color used by headings.

element.name: TCustomGrid.FixedGridLineColor
element.short: Color used to draw lines around fixed grid cells

descr.p: The default value for the is cl3DDKShadow as asssigned in the constructor. Changing the value in FixedGridLineColor causes the grid to be redrawn. The color is not used when GridLineWidth contains the value 0 (zero).
FixedGridLineColor is used in the implementation of the DrawCellGrid method.

element.name: TCustomGrid.FixedHotColor
element.short: FixedHotColor - the 'Hot' color for the active (selected, etc) fixed cells of the grid

element.name: TCustomGrid.Flat
element.short: Is the cell to be displayed Flat, i.e. with no texturing or raised/lowered effect

element.name: TCustomGrid.FocusColor
element.short: The color to be used for the cell receiving focus

element.name: TCustomGrid.FocusRectVisible
element.short: FocusRectVisible - is the rectangle receiving focus visible?

element.name: TCustomGrid.GCache
element.short: GCache - the cache to be used for grid data

element.name: TCustomGrid.GridFlags
element.short: GridFlags - the flags that are set for the grid

element.name: TCustomGrid.GridHeight
element.short: GridHeight - the height of the grid

element.name: TCustomGrid.GridLineColor
element.short: Color to be used for GridLines

element.name: TCustomGrid.GridLineStyle
element.short: Style to be used for GridLines

element.name: TCustomGrid.GridLineWidth
element.short: Width (thickness) of GridLines

element.name: TCustomGrid.GridWidth
element.short: Width of the whole Grid

element.name: TCustomGrid.HeaderHotZones
element.short: HeaderHotZones - the zones of the header that are under the cursor, so are capable of being selected or pushed (or not!)

element.name: TCustomGrid.HeaderPushZones
element.short: HeaderPushZones - the zones of the header that have been selected by the cursor, or pushed

notes.note: Not used in the current implementation. ???
Not used in the current implementation. ???

element.name: TCustomGrid.TabAdvance
element.short: Stores the behavior for Tab navigation used in the grid control

descr.p: TabAdvance is a TAutoAdvance used to determine the behavior for Tab navigation is used in the grid control. The default value for the is aaRightDown. See TAutoAdvance for the values and their usage.
TabAdvance is used in the implementation of the KeyDown method in TCustomGrid.

element.name: TCustomGrid.TitleImageList
element.short: TitleImageList - the list of images to be used with the titles

element.name: TCustomGrid.TitleImageListWidth
element.short: Stores the default width for images used in the title area for fixed cells

descr.p: TitleImageListWidth is an Integer which stores the default width for images used in the title area for fixed cells. The default value for the is 0. Changing the value in TitleImageListWidth causes the VisualChange method to be called to update the grid control.
The value in TitleImageListWidth is used in methods which draw fixed cells in the grid, such as:

element.name: TCustomGrid.InplaceEditor
element.short: InplaceEditor - the editor to be used in-place, i.e. in the cell itself instead of outside the grid

element.name: TCustomGrid.IsCellSelected
element.short: IsCellSelected - is the cell specified by aCol, aRow selected?

element.name: TCustomGrid.LeftCol
element.short: LeftCol - the left-most column

element.name: TCustomGrid.MouseWheelOption
element.short: Sets the mouse wheel behavior for the grid control

descr.p: MouseWheelOption is a TMouseWheelOption used to set the mouse wheel behavior for the grid control. The default value for the is mwCursor, and indicates that mouse wheel movements change the cursor position on the screen. Use mwGrid to cause mouse wheel movements to change the active selection in the grid control.

element.name: TCustomGrid.Options
element.short: Contains the set of optional features and/or behaviors enabled for the grid

descr.p: Options is a TGridOptions used to store the options enabled for the grid control. Values from the TGridOptions enumeration are included in the set type to enable the features or behaviors. For a list of available options and their usage, see.
The default value for the Options is the DefaultGridOptions set.
Use Options2 to set scrolling behaviors enabled for the grid control.

element.name: TCustomGrid.Options2
element.short: Contains additional options enabled for the grid control

element.name: TCustomGrid.RangeSelectMode
element.short: Controls the range selection mode used for the grid

descr.p: RangeSelectMode is a TRangeSelectMode that controls the range selection mode used for the grid. The default value for the is rsmSingle, and allows selection of a single cell in a range. Use rsmMulti to select multiple cells in a range selection.
Changing the value in RangeSelectMode causes the ClearSelections method be called to remove existing selection(s) in the grid control.
RangeSelectMode is used in the implementation of methods like:

element.name: TCustomGrid.Row
element.short: The current Row (record) within the grid

element.name: TCustomGrid.RowCount
element.short: Number of rows in the grid
element.descr: This is the number of rows in the grid, including fixed and normal rows.

element.name: TCustomGrid.RowSizingCursor
element.short: Cursor shape displayed when the row height is changed

element.name: TCustomGrid.RowHeights
element.short: The row heights for the grid.

descr.p: The row is specified with the aRow parameter. The aRow parameter must fall within the valid index range of 0 to RowCount-1.
The return value of the is the height of this row, measured in pixels.

The initial height of a newly created row is specified with the DefaultRowHeight property. After that the user may redefine this value. If the Options includes the appropriate value, the row height may also be changed by the user at run-time.

element.name: TCustomGrid.RowHeights.aRow
element.short: Row number affected in the method

element.name: TCustomGrid.SaveOptions
element.short: The set of options for saving information from the grid (design, attributes, content or position)
element.descr: These options are used when saving grid information, but also when loading grid information.

element.name: TCustomGrid.SelectActive
element.short: SelectActive - if True, the current active cell is selected

element.name: TCustomGrid.SelectedColor
element.short: Color to be used for selected cells

element.name: TCustomGrid.SelectedColumn
element.short: The column (field) currently selected

element.name: TCustomGrid.Selection
element.short: The current selection (rows and columns) in the grid

element.name: TCustomGrid.ScrollBars
element.short: The ScrollBars to be used with this grid

element.name: TCustomGrid.StrictSort
element.short: StrictSort - is strict sorting to be used?

element.name: TCustomGrid.TitleFont
element.short: The font to be used in the grid's title

element.name: TCustomGrid.TitleStyle
element.short: The style to be used for the grid's title

element.name: TCustomGrid.TopRow
element.short: The first row (record) in the grid

element.name: TCustomGrid.UseXORFeatures
element.short: UseXORFeatures: When True, the dotted focus rectangle is painted using the XOR raster operation

descr.p: This controls how the dotted focus rectangle appears in the grid. When True, the rectangle is painted using an XOR raster operation. This allows the focus rectangle to be seen regardless of the cell background color. When False, the user can control the color of the dotted focus rectangle using the FocusColor property.

It also controls the look of column/row resizing operations. When True, a line shows visually the size that the the column or row will have if the user ends the operation. When False, the column or row resizing takes effect as the user drags the mouse.

element.name: TCustomGrid.ValidateOnSetSelection
element.short: Controls whether validation is performed when the text for the selected cell is changed

descr.p: ValidateOnSetSelection is a Boolean property used to control validation performed when the text for the selected cell is changed in the grid. The default value for ValidateOnSetSelection is False, as assigned in the constructor for the class.
ValidateOnSetSelection is used in the SelectionSetText method to determine if the ValidateEntry method is called to validate the content in the cell.

element.name: TCustomGrid.VisibleColCount
element.short: The number of visible columns

element.name: TCustomGrid.VisibleRowCount
element.short: The number of visible rows

element.name: TCustomGrid.OnAfterSelection
element.short: Event handler signalled after a new cell has been selected in the grid

element.name: TCustomGrid.OnBeforeSelection
element.short: OnBeforeSelection - event handler for use before a selection is made

element.name: TCustomGrid.OnCheckboxToggled
element.short: Event handler signalled when the value for a Checkbox cell is toggled

element.name: TCustomGrid.OnCompareCells
element.short: Event handler for comparing the contents of grid cells

element.name: TCustomGrid.OnPrepareCanvas
element.short: Event handler to prepare the Canvas for drawing

element.name: TCustomGrid.OnDrawCell
element.short: Event handler for drawing a cell

element.name: TCustomGrid.OnEditButtonClick
element.short: Event handler for when the Edit button is clicked

element.name: TCustomGrid.OnButtonClick
element.short: Event handler signalled when a button for a column is clicked in the grid

element.name: TCustomGrid.OnPickListSelect
element.short: Event handler for selecting an item from a picklist (e.g. drop-down list in TComboBox)

element.name: TCustomGrid.OnSelection
element.short: Event handler for when an area of a grid (one or a group of cells) is selected

descr.p: The Col and Row parameters contain the column and the row of the highlighted cell.
Application developers can use the OnSelection and OnBeforeSelection events to react to focus changes. Component developers should use the ??? method instead.

element.name: TCustomGrid.OnSelectEditor
element.short: Event handler signalled to select a cell editor

element.name: TCustomGrid.OnTopLeftChanged
element.short: Event handler signalled when the top left cell is changed (i.e. the grid has been scrolled so that a different cell occupies top left)

element.name: TCustomGrid.OnUserCheckboxBitmap
element.short: OnUserCheckboxBitmap - event handler for a user accessing a checkbox bitmap

element.name: TCustomGrid.OnUserCheckboxImage
element.short: Event handler signalled to get an image from an image list used for Checkbox cells

element.name: TCustomGrid.OnValidateEntry
element.short: Event handler used to perform validation for cells

descr.p: OnValidateEntry is a TValidateEntryEvent which implements the event handler signalled to perform validation for cells in the ValidateEntry method.

element.name: TCustomGrid.FlipRect
element.short: Flips coordinates in the rectangle when BiDi or RTL alignment is used

element.name: TCustomGrid.FlipPoint
element.short: Flips coordinates in the point when BiDi or RTL alignment is used

element.name: TCustomGrid.FlipX
element.short: Flips the horizontal position in the client rectangle when BiDi or RTL alignment is used

element.name: TCustomGrid.OnGetCellHint
element.short: Gets the individual hint for each cell
element.descr: OnGetCellHint is a TGetCellHintEvent with the event handler signalled to get the hint for cells in the grid control. OnGetCellHint is signalled when the enumeration value is included in the property.

element.name: TCustomGrid.OnSaveColumn
element.short: Event handler signalled when a column is saved

element.name: TCustomGrid.OnLoadColumn
element.short: Event handler signalled when a column is loaded

element.name: TCustomGrid.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance

descr.p: Create is the constructor for TCustomGrid. Create calls the inherited Create method, allocates the lists with columns and rows, initializes many visual properties and options, creates the various cell editors, and loads any bitmaps required for the display.
descr.remark: The inherited method calls SetBounds and VisualChange, so the grid needs to be fully instantiated before it is called.

element.name: TCustomGrid.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance

descr.p: Destroy is the destructor for TCustomGrid. Destroy frees various resources including editors, columns, rows, and fonts. It calls the inherited Destroy method.

element.name: TCustomGrid.AdjustInnerCellRect
element.short: Adjusts the cell rectangle to account for lines drawn around a cell

element.name: TCustomGrid.AdjustInnerCellRect.ARect
element.short: Cell rectangle adjusted in the method

element.name: TCustomGrid.AutoAdjustColumns
element.short: AutoAdjustColumns - automatically adjust the columns according to the size of their contents.

element.name: TCustomGrid.BeginUpdate
element.short: Begins an update to the grid

descr.p: BeginUpdate is a procedure used to start an update to the layout or content in a grid control. BeginUpdate increments an internal member used to prevent nested calls to the method. The protection remains in effect until the EndUpdate method is called. BeginUpdate is used in the implementation of methods that alter the physical appearance of the grid.

element.name: TCustomGrid.CellRect
element.short: The coordinates for the current cell (column, row) expressed as a standard rectangle (TRect)

element.name: TCustomGrid.CellToGridZone
element.short: Convert the coordinates of the current cell (col, row) to a grid zone

element.name: TCustomGrid.CheckPosition
element.short: Check the position of the cursor

element.name: TCustomGrid.ClearCols
element.short: Clears the cached fixed columns and column count in the grid control

element.name: TCustomGrid.ClearRows
element.short: Clears the cached fixed rows and row count in the grid control

element.name: TCustomGrid.Clear
element.short: Clear all cells from the grid.

descr.p: Reset Column and Row counts to 0. Grid is completely emptied.
Compatibility: This applies to Lazarus grids only , under Delphi/Kylix a grid can't be completely emptied.

element.name: TCustomGrid.ClearSelections
element.short: Clears the current range selection(s) and invalidates the grid control

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorByStyle
element.short: Select a cell editor control with the specified style

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorKeyDown
element.short: Emulate the OnKeyDown event handler in the cell editor

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorKeyPress
element.short: Emulate the OnKeyPress event handler in the cell editor

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorKeyUp
element.short: Emulate the OnKeyUp event handler in the cell editor

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorTextChanged
element.short: Updates the grid control when the value in a cell editor is changed

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorTextChanged.aCol
element.short: Column number for the modified cell

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorTextChanged.aRow
element.short: Row number for the modified cell

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorTextChanged.aText
element.short: New value for the cell

element.name: TCustomGrid.EndUpdate
element.short: EndUpdate - Finish updating the grid

element.name: TCustomGrid.EraseBackground
element.short: Clear the background for the grid control

element.name: TCustomGrid.EraseBackground.DC
element.short: Device context for the drawing operation

element.name: TCustomGrid.Focused
element.short: Indicates if the grid is focused or has an active focused cell editor

element.name: TCustomGrid.HasMultiSelection
element.short: Indicates if multi-select range selection mode is enabled and in use for the grid

descr.p: HasMultiSelection is a Boolean function used to determine if multi-select range selection mode is enabled and in use for the grid. The return value is True when Options includes the value goRangeSelect, RangeSelectMode contains rsmMulti, and Selections contains selection cell rectangles.

element.name: TCustomGrid.HasMultiSelection.Result
element.short: True when multi-select range selection mode is enabled and in use for the grid

element.name: TCustomGrid.InvalidateCell
element.short: InvalidateCell - renders a cell invalid, and redraws if required

element.name: TCustomGrid.InvalidateCol
element.short: InvalidateFromCol - renders the grid invalid from the specified column onwards

element.name: TCustomGrid.InvalidateRange
element.short: InvalidateRange - renders a range of the grid invalid

element.name: TCustomGrid.InvalidateRow
element.short: Invalidates the drawing rectangle for the specified row number

element.name: TCustomGrid.InvalidateRow.ARow
element.short: Row number affected in the method

element.name: TCustomGrid.IsCellVisible
element.short: Finds out whether a particular cell is visible

element.name: TCustomGrid.IsFixedCellVisible
element.short: Determines if the specified cell is a visible fixed cell in the grid

element.name: TCustomGrid.LoadFromFile
element.short: Load the grid data from a file with the specified name
element.descr: Note that the SaveOptions determines what information is loaded.

element.name: TCustomGrid.LoadFromFile.FileName
element.short: File name with the content loaded in the method

element.name: TCustomGrid.LoadFromStream
element.short: Loads the content for the grid from the specified stream

element.name: TCustomGrid.LoadFromStream.AStream
element.short: TStream instance with values loaded in the method

element.name: TCustomGrid.MouseCoord
element.short: Find the mouse coordinates relative to the grid origin

element.name: TCustomGrid.MouseToCell
element.short: Convert mouse coordinates to the position of a cell in the grid

element.name: TCustomGrid.MouseToLogcell
element.short: Convert mouse coordinates to the position of a logical cell in the grid

element.name: TCustomGrid.MouseToGridZone
element.short: MouseToGridZone - convert mouse coordinates to a grid zone

element.name: TCustomGrid.SaveToFile
element.short: Save the data in the grid to a file with specified name
element.descr: Note that the SaveOptions determines what information is saved.

element.name: TCustomGrid.SaveToStream
element.short: Saves information for the grid to the specified stream

descr.p: SaveToStream is a virtual procedure used to store information for the grid control in the TStream instance specified in AStream. SaveToStream creates a TXMLConfig class instance that is used to capture the layout, cell display settings, grid options, and range selections for the control.
SaveToStream calls the SaveContent method to generate the XML content for the grid control. The XML content is written to AStream using the WriteToStream method in TXMLConfig.
Use LoadFromStream to read the grid information stored in the stream.

element.name: TCustomGrid.SaveToStream.AStream
element.short: TStream instance where grid information is stored

element.name: TCustomGrid.SetFocus
element.short: Sets focus to the grid control

descr.p: SetFocus is an overridden procedure used to make the grid control the currently focused control. SetFocus ensures that pending Tab key navigation for an active cell editor is handled properly. If an Editor is both available and visible, it calls its SetFocus method. Otherwise, the grid control becomes the focused control.

element.name: TCustomGrid.CursorState
element.short: Current cursor state for the grid control

descr.p: CursorState is a read-only TGridCursorState property which contains the current cursor state or shape for the grid control. The value in CursorState is updated when methods are called which perform resizing or moving/dragging for columns and rows.
Use the ColRowDraggingCursor, ColSizingCursor, or RowSizingCursor properties to read or write the cursor shapes used for the corresponding actions.
Use RestoreCursor to set the cursor to its default value.

element.name: TCustomGrid.SelectedRange
element.short: Provides indexed access to TGridRect values in the currently selected range

descr.p: SelectedRange is a read-only indexed TGridRect property used to get the cell rectangles in Selections for the grid control. SelectedRange is applicable when multi-select range mode has been enabled in the RangeSelectMode property. Otherwise, the current cell selection at Col and Row is returned as the selected range value.
Use SelectedRangeCount to get the number TGridRect instances in SelectedRange.
Use AddSelectedRange to add the current cell selection to the multi-select range in Selections.
Use ClearSelections to remove the cell rectangles stored in Selections.

element.name: TCustomGrid.SelectedRangeCount
element.short: Number of cell rectangles in the current selected range

element.name: TCustomGrid.SortOrder
element.short: Order of sorting - ascending or descending

element.name: TCustomGrid.SortColumn
element.short: Column position used to sort the rows in the grid

descr.p: SortColumn is a read-only Integer that contains the column position used to sort content rows in the grid. SortColumn is used in the HeaderClick method to determine if the click occurred on the fixed header cell represented by the property. It is also used in the DrawColumnTitleImage method if the header cell needs to render an image representing the current sort order.

element.name: TCustomGrid.IMEStartComposition
element.short: Handles IME Composition start messages
element.descr: Defined for Windows platforms only.

element.name: TCustomGrid.IMEComposition
element.short: Handles IME Composition messages
element.descr: Defined for Windows platforms only.

element.name: TGetEditEvent
element.short: Specifies an event handler used to get edit values or masks in a grid
element.descr: TGetEditEvent is an object procedure type used for event handlers which get edit values or masks in a grid control. TGetEditEvent is the type used for the OnGetEditMask and OnGetEditText event handlers in TCustomDrawGrid.

element.name: TGetEditEvent.Sender
element.short: Object for the event notification

element.name: TGetEditEvent.ACol
element.short: Column number for the notification

element.name: TGetEditEvent.ARow
element.short: Row number for the notification

element.name: TGetEditEvent.Value
element.short: Value returned from the event handler

element.name: TSetEditEvent
element.short: Specifies an event handler used to set the value for edit text in a grid

element.name: TSetEditEvent.Sender
element.short: Object for the event notification

element.name: TSetEditEvent.ACol
element.short: Column number for the notification

element.name: TSetEditEvent.ARow
element.short: Row number for the notification

element.name: TSetEditEvent.Value
element.short: Value applied to the specified cell in the event handler

element.name: TGetCheckboxStateEvent
element.short: Specifies an event handler signalled to get the state for a Checkbox cell in a grid

element.name: TSetCheckboxStateEvent
element.short: Specifies an event handler signalled to set the state for a Checkbox cell in a grid

element.name: TCustomDrawGrid
element.short: Base class for custom drawn grids

descr.p: TCustomDrawGrid is a TCustomGrid descendant used as the base class for custom drawn grids including TDrawGrid and TStringGrid. TCustomDrawGrid provides overridden methods needed to work with cells using the TVirtualGrid class instance in the Grid property. Applications should not create instance of TCustomDrawGrid; use of the descendent classes like TDrawGrid or TStringGrid.

element.name: TCustomDrawGrid.FGrid
element.short: FGrid - local variable holding a virtual grid on which to work

element.name: TCustomDrawGrid.CalcCellExtent

element.name: TCustomDrawGrid.CreateVirtualGrid

element.name: TCustomDrawGrid.DrawCellAutonumbering
element.short: DrawCellAutonumbering - draws a cell using auto numbering

element.name: TCustomDrawGrid.DrawFocusRect
element.short: DrawFocusRect - draws the rectangle currently receiving focus

element.name: TCustomDrawGrid.NotifyColRowChange
element.short: NotifyColRowChange tells the system that a column or row has been changed (determined by IsColumn) and whether this was an Insert

element.name: TCustomDrawGrid.Create.AOwner

element.short: AutoSizeColumn - automatically adjust width of column to accommodate widest text

descr.p: This procedure sets the column width to the size of the widest text it finds in all rows for the column aCol.
Tip: see the goDblClickAutoSize option to allow columns to be automatically resized when doubleClicking the column border.

element.name: TCustomStringGrid.AutoSizeColumns
element.short: AutoSizeColumns - automatically resizes all columns by adjusting them to fit in the longest text in each column
element.descr: Automatically resizes all columns by adjusting them to fit in the longest text in each column. This is a quick method of applying the AutoSizeColumn method for every column in the grid.

element.name: TCustomStringGrid.Clean
element.short: Cleans all cells in the grid using the specified CleanOptions

descr.p: Cleans all cells in the grid subject to the given CleanOptions, optionally specifying a range of cells or a rectangular region. See for more information.
The cleaning operation does not change the number of rows and columns. It only replaces the cell content by empty strings.
Some examples:

ul.li: Clean all cells: grid.Clean([]); (the same as grid.clean)
Clean all non fixed cells: grid.Clean([gzNormal]);
Clean all cells but don't touch grid column headers: Grid.Clean([gzNormal, gzFixedRows]);

element.name: TCustomStringGrid.CopyToClipboard
element.short: CopyToClipboard - copy a range of cells to clipboard

descr.p: CopyToClipboard will copy a range of cells into the clipboard; the cells values are TAB separated. The range is defined based on optional AUseSelection parameter (which is False by default) and indicates the range is set to the whole grid, including fixed cols/rows. If AUseSelection is True, the range of cells is set to the current .

element.name: TCustomStringGrid.Cells
element.short: Cells - the text content of a cell or cells, indexed by aCol, aRow

descr.p: Cells is an indexed String property used to read or write the content for a cell in the grid. The ACol and ARow indexes are used the access a value stored at the requested column and row position.
Reading the value causes the pointer to the cell in Celda to return its Text value.

Setting the value causes the pointer to the cell in Celda to be updated at the specified coordinates. An active cell editor will be cancelled if it is not locked, and the value in Modified is reset to False.

topic.name: HowToUseGrids
topic.short: How to use Grids including StringGrids, DrawGrids and DbGrids

descr.p: Grids are components derived from the TCustomControl class and do not have a native widget associated with them. So they are not restricted by the look of the current interface theme. This can be both an advantage and a disadvantage: usually programmers want to create a uniform-look application. Lazarus grids are flexible enough to allow programmers to make them look similar to other native controls; alternatively they can customize the grid to obtain almost the same look in any platform or widget interface (with the exception of scrollbars, whose look is still determined by the current theme).

Some properties can affect the way the grid looks by acting when the cell is about to be painted in PrepareCanvas/OnPrepareCanvas by changing default canvas properties like brush color or font. Following is a list of such properties:

table.caption: Properties and Events for Customizing Grids

tr.td: The user can change the background color that appears on alternate rows. This is to allow easy reading of grid rows data.
Sets the primary color used to draw non fixed cells' background.
The color used to draw fixed cells' background.
Eliminates the 3d look of fixed cells.
Font used to draw the text in fixed cells.

td.p: Changes the 3D look of fixed cells. There are 3 settings:

dl.dd: The default look
Tries to use an appearance that is in concordance with the current widgetset theme
A more contrasted look, like Delphi grids

tr.td: If true, alternate color is always in the second row after fixed rows; the first row after fixed rows will always be the default color. If false, default color is set to the first row as if there were no fixed rows.
Sets the grid's border color used when Flat=True and BorderStyle=bsSingle;

If set to bsNone under Windows the cell editors will not have the border, like in Delphi; set to bsSingle by default because the border can be theme specific in some widgetsets and to allow a uniform look.
The color used to draw the current focused cell if UseXORFeatures is not set; by default this is clRed.
Turns on/off the drawing of focused cell.
Color of grid lines in non fixed area.
Pen style used to draw lines in non fixed area, possible choices are: psSolid, psDash, psDot, psDashDot, psDashDotDot, psinsideFrame, psPattern, psClear; default is psSolid.
Color used to draw cell background on selected cells.
If set, focus rect is drawn using XOR mode so it should make visible the focus rect in combination with any cell color background. It also affects the way that moving columns look.

Normally the grid prepares its grid canvas using properties according to the kind of cell that is being painted. If the user has written an OnDrawCell event handler, DefaultDrawing (if set) also paints the cell background; if the user is taking full responsibility for drawing the cell it is better to turn off this so painting is not duplicated. In a StringGrid, if DefaultDrawing is set it draws the text in each cell.
Where the cell cursor will go when pressing enter or tab/shift tab, or after editing.
If true, the user can resize columns, not just at the headers, but anywhere along the column's height.

p.b: Other Properties that Affect Grid Appearance:

descr.p: This is a set of zero or more choices, with some elements that enable diverse functionality but others that are related directly with grid's look. Options can be set at design-time or run-time.

dl.dd: Draws a vertical or horizontal line respectively, delimiting cells or columns in the fixed area; active by default.
The same as previous, but for the normal browseable area. A grid can be made to simulate a listbox by unsetting both of these options.

If this option is enabled, a selection background is painted in the focused cell in addition to the focused dotted rectangle. Please note: this doesn't work when the goRowSelect option is set; in such case the row is always painted as if goDrawFocusSelected is set.
Selects the full row instead of individual cells.
If set, grid will do numbering of rows in first fixed column.

If set, the grid will try to show a different look when the mouse cursor is over any fixed cell. In order for this to work, desired cell zone needs to be enabled with the HeaderHotZones. Try combining this option with TitleStyle= tsNative to get themed hot tracking look.
If set, this option enables a pushed look when clicking any fixed cell. The zone of "pushable" cells is enabled using HeaderPushedZones property.

p.b: Description of the Grid Drawing Process

descr.p: Like other custom controls, the grid is drawn using the paint method. In general terms the grid is drawn by painting all rows, and each row by painting its individual cells. The process is as follows:

ul.li: First, the visible cells area is determined: each row is tested to see if it intersects the canvas clipping region; if it's OK, then the visible area is painted by drawing columns of each row.

The column and row values are used to identify the cell that is about to be painted and again each column is tested for intersection with the clipping region; if everything is OK, some additional properties like the cell's rectangular extent and visual state are passed as arguments to the DrawCell method.

li.p: As the drawing process is running, the visual state of each cell is adjusted according to grid options and position within grid. The visual state is retained in a variable of type TGridDrawState which is a set with following elements:

tr.td: The cell will have a selected look.
The cell will have a focused look.
Cell have to be painted with fixed cell look.
the mouse is over this cell, so paint it with hot tracking look
the cell is being clicked, paint it with pushed look

li.p: DrawCell - The DrawCell method is virtual and may be overridden in descendent grids to do custom drawing. The information passed to DrawCell helps to identify which particular cell is being painted, the physical area occupied on the screen and its visible status. See DrawCell reference for details. For each cell the following occurs:

ul.li: PrepareCanvas - If the DefaultDrawing is set, the grid canvas is setup with default properties for brush and font based on current visual state. For several design and run-time properties, the text alignment is set to match programmer selection in custom columns if they exists. If DefaultDrawing is false, brush color is set to clWindow and Font color to clWindowText, the text alignment is set with grids defaultTextStyle value.

OnPrepareCanvas - If the programmer wrote an event handler for the OnPrepareCanvas event, it is called at this point. This event can be used for doing simple customization like changing a cell's background color, font's properties like color, font face and style, Text layout like different combinations of left, center, top, bottom, right alignment, etc. Any change made to the canvas for a particular cell in this event would be lost, because the next cell drawing will reset canvas again to a default state. So it's safe doing changes only for a particular cell or cells and forget about it for the rest. Using this event sometimes helps to avoid using the OnDrawCell grid event, where users would be forced to duplicate the grid's drawing code.

OnDrawCell - Next, if no handler for the OnDrawCell event was specified, the grid calls the DefaultDrawCell method which simply paints the cell background using the current canvas brush color and style. If the OnDrawCell handler exists, the grid first paints the cell background, but only if the DefaultDrawing was set; then it calls the OnDrawCell event to do custom cell painting. Usually programmers want to do custom drawing only for particular cells, but standard drawing for others: in this case, they can restrict custom operation to certain cell or cells by looking into ACol, ARow and AState arguments, and for other cells simply call the DefaultDrawCell method and let the grid to take care of it.
Text - At this point, if the DefaultDrawing is true, the cell's text content is painted (only for TStringGrid).

Grid lines - The last step for each cell is to paint the grid lines: if grid options goVertLine, goHorzLine, goFixedVertLine and goFixedHorzLine are specified the cell grid is drawn at this point. Grids with only rows or only cols can be obtained by changing these options. If the programmer elected to have a "themed" look it is done at this point also (see TitleStyle).
FocusRect - When all columns of the current row have been painted it is time to draw the focus rectangle for the current selected cell or for the whole row if the goRowSelect option is set.

descr.p: The location of a grid's current (focused) cell (or row) can be changed using keyboard, mouse or through code. In order to change cell focus successfully to another position, we must test the target position to see if it is allowed to receive cell focus. When using the keyboard, AutoAdvance performs part of the process by finding what should be the next focused cell. When using mouse clicks or moving by code, focus will not move from the current cell unless the target cell is permitted to receive focus.

The grid calls SelectCell to see if a cell is focusable: if this function returns true, then the target cell identified with arguments aCol and aRow is focusable (the current implementation of TCustomGrid simply returns true). TCustomDrawGrid and hence TDrawGrid and TStringGrid override this method and check first if a cell is any wider than 0; normally you don't want a 0 width cell selected so a cell with this characteristics is skipped automatically in the process of finding a suitable cell. The overridden method SelectCell also calls the user configurable event OnSelectCell: this event receives the cell coordinates as arguments and always returns a default result of True.

Once a cell is known to be focusable and we are sure a movement will take place, the method BeforeMoveSelection is called; this in turns triggers the OnBeforeSelection event. This method's arguments are the coordinates for the new focused cell; at this point any visible editor is hidden too. The "before" word means that selection is not yet changed and current focused coordinates can be accessed with grid.Col and grid.Row properties.

After that, the internal focused cell coordinates are changed and MoveSelection is called; this method's purpose (if set) is to trigger the OnSelection event (this is a notification that the focused cell has changed and the new cell coordinates are available through grid.row and grid.col properties).

Note that is not good to use the OnSelectCell event to detect cell focus changes, as this event will be triggered several times even for the same cell in the process of finding a suitable cell. Is better to use OnBeforeSelection or OnSelection events for this purpose.
Users can specify what editor will be used for a cell using one of two methods.

ol.li: Using a custom column and selecting the ButtonStyle of the column. In this method the user can select the style of the editor that will be shown. Available values are: cbsAuto, cbsEllipsis, cbsNone, cbsPickList, cbsCheckboxColumn.

li.p: Here the user specifies in the Editor parameter which editor to use for a cell identified by aCol, ARow in a TCustomDrawGrid derived grid or TColumn in TCustomDBGrid. The public EditorByStyle() function takes as parameter one of the following values: cbsAuto, cbsEllipsis, cbsNone, cbsPickList, cbsCheckboxColumn.
This method takes precedence over the first one using custom columns. A Custom cell editor can be specified here, with values specific to the cell, row or column.

descr.p: The following is a description of the editor styles. They are enumerated values of type TColumnButtonStyle and so they are prefixed by 'cbs'. This type was used to remain compatible with Delphi's DBGrid.

ul.li: cbsAuto - This is the default editor style for TCustomGrid derived grids. The TStringCellEditor derived from TCustomMaskEdit is specialized to edit single line strings and is used by default in TStringGrid and TDrawGrid. When using Custom Columns, if the programmer filled the Column's PickList property, this behaves as if cbsPickList editor style was set. For a TCustomDBGrid that has a field of type Boolean, it behaves as if cbsCheckBoxColumn editor style was specified. This is the recommended value for custom cell editors. TODO: related OnEditingDone.

li.p: cbsEllipsis - This editor style is the most generic one. A button with ellipsis (...) appears in the editing cell and the programmer can use the OnEditButtonClick grid event to take any programmed action when the user presses the button. For example a calendar dialog could pop up to allow the user to select a specific date, a file open dialog could appear to find files, or a calculator could appear so the user could enter the numeric result of calculations, etc.

ul.li: OnEditButtonClick is just a notification, to find out in which cell a button has been clicked by taking a look at the grid.Row and grid.Col properties.
A DBGrid has specific properties to retrieve the active column or field and because this event occurs in the active record, it could update the information in the active field.
This editor style is implemented using TButtonCellEditor, a direct descendant of TButton.
cbsNone - This editor style instructs the grid not to use any editor for a specific cell or column; it behaves then, as if the grid were read-only for such a cell or column.

li.p: cbsPickList - Used to present the user with a list of values that can be entered. This editor style is implemented using TPickListCellEditor, a component derived from TCustomComboBox. The list of values that are shown is filled in one of two ways depending on the method used to select the editor style.
When using custom columns, programmers can enter a list of values using the column's PickList property. [FOR BEGINNERS: TODO: exact procedure to edit the list]

cbsCheckboxColumn - This editor style is at the moment only available in TDBGrid. If a field's contents associated with the column are restricted to a pair of values, for example, yes-no, true-false, on-off, 1-0, etc then cbsCheckboxColumn is used to modify the appearance of a column by using a checkbox representation that the user can toggle by using a mouse click or pressing the SPACE key.

ul.li: If a ButtonStyle for a column is set to cbsAuto and DBGrid detects that the field associated with the column is a Boolean field, then the grid uses this editor style automatically. This automatic selection can be disabled or enabled using DBGrid's OptionsExtra property; setting dgeCheckboxColumn element to false disables this feature.
The values that are used to recognize the checked or unchecked states are set in a column's properties ValueChecked and ValueUnchecked.
At any moment, the field value can be in one to three states: Unchecked, Checked or Grayed.

notes.note: ToDo: samples of what can be made and what to leave for OnDrawCell?
